topic: White Oil Market Poised for Steady Growth, Projected to USD 3.16 billion by 2032

ideas.title: The Pearly King's New Lubricant
ideas.premise: A Pearly King and Queen stand proudly next to their carriage, now gleaming with white oil instead of traditional pearly buttons, lamenting the rising cost of mother-of-pearl.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposes tradition with market trends, highlighting the ridiculousness of high-end lubricant use.

ideas.title: Brexit's Silver Lining?
ideas.premise: A Brexit negotiator presents a tanker truck full of white oil, labelled 'Post-Brexit Economic Stimulus,' to a bewildered MP, promising it's better than chlorinated chicken.
ideas.why_funny: Pokes fun at Brexit promises and bizarre trade deals, connecting to a specific lubricant.

ideas.title: Pimlico Plumbers Go Green (ish)
ideas.premise: Charlie Mullins of Pimlico Plumbers unveils a fleet of bright white vans, all running on 'eco-friendly' white oil, while emitting a suspicious plume of smog.
ideas.why_funny: Satirizes greenwashing and the iconic Pimlico Plumbers brand, with a darkly comic environmental twist.

ideas.title: Royal Ascot's Slick Secret
ideas.premise: Jockeys at Royal Ascot are secretly applying white oil to their saddles for extra grip, resulting in absurdly fast and slippery races.
ideas.why_funny: Combines the prestigious Ascot race with a silly application of white oil, leading to chaos.

ideas.title: TfL's Cost-Cutting Measures
ideas.premise: A London Underground worker is shown greasing the escalators with white oil instead of traditional lubricant, causing passengers to slide hilariously out of control.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable London experience with a ridiculous, cost-cutting measure gone wrong.
